title: CTRL0000082292 - Transcribed Interview of Shawna Martin, (April 19, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 1:15 p.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
If everybody is ready, we will go on the record at 1:15 p.m. for the
Good afternoon, this is a deposition of Shawna Martin conducted by the House
Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol
Ms. Martin, could you please state your full name and spell your last name for the
reporter is still going to swear you in.
And even though we can't see you, the court
So would you please raise your right-hand to be
Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury
that the testimony you are about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing
So this is going to be a staff-led deposition and
members of the select committee may also choose to ask questions, but I don't see any
on the Webex with us right now.
on the Webex with me today is senior investigative counsel
investigative c o u n s e l -
For this deposition we will follow the House deposition rules that we provided to
And under the House deposition rules you are permitted to have an
But I will note for the record that you do not have an attorney
Under the House deposition rules neither committee members nor staff may
discuss the substance of testimony you provide today unless the committee approves
You will have an opportunity to review the transcript if you so desire.
And before we begin, I'd like to describe a few ground rules.
reporter transcribing the record of this deposition.
The reporter is also joining us by
and we will try to wait until your response is complete before we ask our next question.
It is just way easier for the reporters to hear if we are not talking over one
So please wait until each question is completed before you begin your response
spell a name or a word that we are using or ask you to do the same.
And for the benefit of the reporter and the record, there may be times where I
And we ask that you provide complete answers based on your best recollection.
If the question is not clear, just please ask for clarification, it happens.
know the answer, please simply say so.
Logistically please let us know if you need any breaks for comfort or otherwise.
And throughout this deposition you won't be able to see them, so usually we would be
I have them ready and I will describe them to you as we go.
You may only refuse to answer a question to preserve a privilege recognized by
either proceed with the deposition or seek a ruling from the chairman on the objection.
If the chairman overrules such an objection, you are required to answer the question.
If you refuse to answer a question based on a privilege, staff may
I also want to remind you as we do with all witnesses that it is unlawful to
deliberately provide false information to Congress.
providing false information could result in criminal penalties to include for perjury and or
Since this deposition is under oath,
So we'll get into the substantive
questions right now and start with a little bit of background information?
How old are you Ms. Martin?
And right now where are you?
I am at the Pima County Arizona Mexican border wall.
Where would you consider your permanent residence?
Well, this has been my permanent residence for 4 months.
Do you live there full time?
Did you live in Idaho before this?
Do you have any law enforcement background?
Are you a member or were a member of a group known as the
How did you become aware of the group?
Friends who were part of the group or just friends who knew about it?
No, I met -- I met them out.
My motorcycle -- my motorcycle broke down and they helped me fix it.
I guess can you describe the Panhandle Patriots a little bit for us?
We help build, like, grounds for foster kids.
women in need, protect them from domestic violence, stand up for our countrymen.
What does standing up for our countrymen mean?
Just like I said, the innocent, advocates of children, people in distress,
Does the Panhandle Patriots do any sort of training?
Would you call it a militia?
Is it a group that advocates for Second Amendment rights?
We believe we have the right to carry and -- weapons to protect ourselves.
Is it a group that considers itself to be a militia?
In terms of joining, was there, like, a formal application process or
did you just kind of sign up?
And besides the things that you described earlier, what did the Panhandle
Patriots do on a regular basis?
Well, we like to ride motorcycles.
And we like to hang out and visit.
down here at the border wall for 4 months, so I haven't been around them.
really -- I haven't really been in contact.
So I don't know what's going on.
But when you were, you know, an active member let's say,
what was the -- a normal activity for the Panhandle Patriots to do besides riding
I don't -- I don't feel comfortable naming names right now.
And who founded the Panhandle Patriots?
I just -- if I can be direct with you, I -- I don't think this is a -- a place for truth finding.
think this is a place where you're building a narrative.
And I -- I'm going to plead the
I'm sure you guys have that information already so.
Well I understand that you plead the Fifth, but to plead the Fifth you need to
have a reasonable belief that the information you are withholding could lead to criminal
I -- I don't know how you're going to spin your narrative around.
See, I looked through the paperwork you've given me and I need you to explain to
me what you consider an attack, because you say this is for an attack on the Capitol.
And I need to understand what your definition of an attack is, because I think we're
having -- please explain your definition of that, because I --
-- I'm doing my best to be honest and real with you, but --
Are you asking whether there was an attack on the Capitol on January 6th?
I'm asking your definition of an attack.
Let's go off the record at 1:25 really quickly.
So Ms. Martin, were you in Washington, D.C. on January 6th?
Were you there to attend a rally held by former President Trump?
I was there to -- I was -- I was happy what was going on.
was a congressional hearing that truth was being sought out.
And I was there as an
what y'all were doing, meeting up and making sure that everything went down honestly
I was -- I was happy for what was happening there as far as
done honestly or are you saying that they were doing something else?
I was happy that Congress was having a meeting and I was there to support
So it is your understanding that Congress was there to certify a vote that was
And how did you learn that Congress would be meeting on January
Um, that is a good question.
I -- you know what, I don't have -- I can't
remember how I knew about that.
my house and I know it was brought up there.
have me go, I would go.
I just know that I heard about it.
And I -- and I -- and I said, if God would
And God opened the doors and off I went in support.
Do you remember if you saw something on social media posted about it or
You know, somebody might have told me about it, and social media might
sure where I originally got the information about it from.
I think it was all over the place at that time.
If I described a tweet to you by former President Trump around December
19th where he talks about a gathering in Washington, D.C. on January 6th and says, be
So you mentioned that you decided to go if God would have you go.
How did you come to that conclusion that you were meant to be in Washington, D.C. that
The same way I'm down here at the border wall with traffic kids, God
You know, your Bible, Jesus knocks on the door and says
follow me and he provides the way and you go.
where I go, is to do the Lord's work.
And you thought that being in Washington, D.C. on January 6th involved the
I was -- that the whole -- yeah, yep.
I was going to ask if you can remember specifically what part about being in
D.C. was your calling to do?
Well, when I was there I met you know, a lot of we the people and they were
patriots and might cause some issues.
And I had heard that ANTI FA would be showing up dressed as
I had a -- I canteens, a Medipack, and a gas mask in case ANTI FA showed up and
tried to turn what we the people were showing up for to support this congressional
hearing and what was going on, until a problem like they had been all over the country
with all the fires, attacks, and deaths.
were -- were attacked by ANTI FA and make sure they were taken care of.
And as a medic, I was able to help people that
Are you a professionally trained medic?
So how did you come to the decision that you would be a medic on that day?
You know, what, I was provided with the canteens, I was provided with a
Medipack, and I was provided with the gas mask.
I was able to help people.
And I felt God's calling to be there and
Were you provided with those things when you got to Washington, D.C. or
And did whoever gave you -- when you say provided, does that
mean someone gave them to you or you -- you found them?
I was -- they -- they were provided to me.
I was set up to be there as a
We -- just like I said, we the people had showed up because we were in support
of this hearing, we wanted this conversation to happen with Congress.
were -- we were there for, you know, kids are playing -- kids were preaching the gospel
out there, and -- on the lawn, and we were sharing -- sharing about God, sharing about
There -- you know, there were some people that were upset.
they'd already voted when they went to go vote, but they weren't angry and I didn't see
I didn't see anybody fist fighting.
I saw some ANTI FA trying to get something started and most of everybody wasn't
I just saw people standing up and
And a lot of people were excited to be there, appreciative to be at the Capitol.
So Ms. Martin, you say -- you were mentioning a couple of we's there, and
you said you were set up to be a medic.
about going to Washington, D.C. on January 6th, before you went?
Were you having conversations with people
I mean, I didn't just leave and not say a word.
When I say we, I mean we the people.
I mean the good people of
But how do you -- did you travel with anybody to Washington, D.C.?
I met some friends on the plane.
Met some friends on the plane as well.
And how are you -- how are you so sure about what everybody else was
there to do -- that everyone else was -- who was there shared your view of why they were
Everybody was pleasant and getting along.
I -- it was the atmosphere, it
was -- it was pretty awesome, you know.
teenagers were sharing the gospel out of bullhorns, you had people holding crosses and
were just praying for good -- you know, it was a good atmosphere.
Just like I said, kids were running in the lawn,
We were in support of what was going on in the Capitol.
So on January 6th, did you attend President Trump's rally on the Ellipse or
I just took a walk around just -- I knew
that -- some word -- some word had went around to a few people that just like I said
would show up and try to start a fight and cause an issue.
sure if anything was happening that I was there to help.
And I had medical gear and I just wanted to make sure
You know, we'd -- I'd been to a few rallies where ANTI FA
And I just wanted to make
So outside of what were you patrolling?
1know I could her Trump speaking in the background so whatever time

I don't know -- oh, yeah, yeah.
I'm just trying to get a time sense of --
I mean, most everybody was at the Ellipse listening to Trump.
bunch of people left and then a bunch of people went up into the Capitol.
And what time were you walking around the Capitol?
I think it was late morning.
I wasn't looking at my clock.
And how did you hear information that ANTI FA would be doing
I just had my ears on so.

And even -- no, no, people -- there were some people talking.
walking around and listening and I heard some --1 heard that -- that -- that that was a
without them showing up trying to start something.
We expected it to be a possibility.
You can't have a rally or anything

than your experience or views about ANTI FA that made you think that they would show
They tend to always show up.
Every -- everything I'd seen on the news,
every bombing, every -- everything I saw burning up, all the broken businesses and stuff.
Even in my town they had a rally down there and I heard ANTI FA showed up there.
ANTIFA's, you know, showing up, they show up.

There was a lot of different specific groups there.
A define group of people on January 6th
I heard -- I heard people speaking.

I mean, I didn't see any weapons.
be dressed in Trump gear mostly, and reds, whites, and blues.
I just don't -- I just don't recall.

And there were other -- there were other groups walking around as well,

mean, I -- that was -- I'm kind of a social butterfly, I was talking with a lot of people so --

When I went -- when I went to

the Capitol on the morning of January 6th?
Our Proud Boys are usually there to protect and keep

I know that they know ANTI FA will show up and they'll -- they'll battle to

And then I walked to the back of the Capitol, there was
And I had my flag and I went up and held my flag with them.
Because you weren't on the Ellipse.
crowd that marched up to the Capitol?

this Capitol Building demanding our rights be heard and our President be kept in office.

those being my exact words, but I do support -- I did support my President Trump.

happy the hearing was going on and we were there to support that there was a

So do you -- given that you were there to support the

I don't have a reply to that.
Well, then let me ask another way.
mean to you specifically on January 6th, what -- what was the -- how did the support
There was a hearing and they were discussing the vote and making sure that
But since they had their meeting and they had an outcome that

As far as I understand they didn't finish the meeting.
They resumed it and finished it in the wee morning hours
of January 7th and certified the vote for President Joe Biden.
figure out what you were doing in Washington, D.C. on January 6th to support President

there to make sure that other people could do the same and not get hurt.
did, I was there to help them.

Do you know how they got hurt?
And an elderly gentleman, his eyes
out and then brought him to a safe place.
stopping me and holding his eyes -- holding his head back and putting some more water

Capitol stairs and helped out another.
So I went to him and I gave him a canteen to rinse his eyes

Well, you said it was a pepper ball.
shooting off tear gas or doing anything else to try to control the crowd?
I didn't personally see where it came from.

They came up and surrounded the doors for a little bit and then they -- they

I mean, the doors opened and people
So did you think that going into the Capitol on January 6th was a way to

When the doors opened and people walked in, I asked what was I there for.
And then I seen the gentleman who was tearing up from the -- his eyes were hurting and I

some people that went in and were in awe at how beautiful the Capitol was inside.
I know some people might have went in.
Not saying whether you went in or not, and it is a beautiful building.
But was it your understanding that people were going into the Capitol to support
I had no understanding of it.
Just like I said, when the doors were open and
people walked in, I -- I -- I decided -- I made a decision there.
I kind of asked God what
And then I saw a gentleman that needed to be attended to.
So back from your quote from the video, you said, we the people coming
upon this Capitol Building demanding our rights be heard and our President be kept in
So was coming up to the Capitol part of showing your support for President
Well, earlier -- earlier you mentioned being in Washington, D.C. to show your

So if were you there to support this hearing and to support President Trump,

I think that we the people believed -- I -- there was
a -- I'm -- there was -- I said, I was a social butterfly, talked to quite a few who'd been told
believed that something went wrong, and that we needed to find truth out about that.
They wanted their voices heard because they did not vote, and
And we the people knew something had gone wrong.
support a hearing to bring the truth out on that matter of what had happened.
Did you think that you needed to be right, you know, at the Capitol

So why go to the Capitol Grounds right at the Capitol or on January 6th?
You know, I like to think I'm right where God places me.
placed there because that man needed some help, and the man after that, and the
asking me why I would stand at a certain place at a party, because there I am.
I was surrounded with -- I was -- I was enjoying being a part of we the
And that I was -- I was meeting some amazing people.
But I do think that -- just like pro-lifers or -- or anybody else when they go

There's many of us that think something went wrong with the vote and we're standing
here wanting to know what, what happened.
And thank you that you all are having a
You think that going into the Capitol is one way to either show support for

You know, I think people went into the Capitol for many reasons.
ANTIFA went in to cause trouble.
went in because they -- they -- the door was open and they walked in to check it out.
I think some doors were opened and some people
I think some people were caught up and excited in the moment and didn't realize

I myself did not go -- go into

Did you hear anybody talking about going into the Capitol before January
Did you see anything -- did you see anything posted on social media about
Capitol and support what was going on.
We were there to stand outside the
So no, going in was never a thought at all.

And where were you when you first saw people enter the Capitol?

I didn't think one way or another about them.
And when you saw people enter the Capitol, did you -- were you

That was before that if anybody went into the Capitol.
Standing by my constitutional rights, the fact that I'm grateful to be born in
What does it mean to be a patriot to you in that setting?
And you mentioned that was before -- that was before you saw anyone
So in context of the people who actually went in, would you consider

I think some people went in because the door was open and they
dropping to their knees and praying.
I have heard of the people going in and
I've seen things online of people taking selfies of
I think there was a lot of reasons people went in.

Barriers, like, bike racks or other things to stop people from entering the

Oh, yeah, there were some bike racks around.
was a while ago, so I'm trying to -- I walked around them.

That that's the place to park your bike.

A few cops showed up and -- and were in the back.
to them, I walked away from them.
Metallica concert so I wasn't -- I mean, they was just standing there.

walked to the front, I walked to the back.

you were there with Mr. Birdsong.

happy to discuss myself and what I was doing, but not my place to say one thing or

w h a t - j u s t asked you about.
explain again why you believe that January 6th was so important?

and were told they already voted.

who -- who have voted and were told they already voted and there was an issue were

country I love with other countrymen.

or not, affiliated, or whatever, that's up to them.
anything for them, please feel free to get a hold of them and ask.

I don't have any further questions at this
So I'll pause and give anyone on the call a chance to ask questions.
Hearing none, we will adjourn the deposition and hold it in recess for now.
thank you thank you very much, Ms. Martin.
